selected_quotes: A review this week discusses the nature and timescales of stratospheric ozone recovery
Detecting recovery of the stratospheric #ozone layer - Professor Neil Harris has co-authored a new
Just published. Our review paper confirming ozone recovery is on the way
We CAN solve big environmental problems if we want to. Exhibit A
Capa de ozono. La culpable de no filtrar radiaciones solares y aumentar cancer de piel. Parece que mejora.

citation.abstract: As a result of the 1987 Montreal Protocol and its amendments, the atmospheric loading of anthropogenic ozone-depleting substances is decreasing. Accordingly, the stratospheric ozone layer is expected to recover. However, short data records and atmospheric variability confound the search for early signs of recovery, and climate change is masking ozone recovery from ozone-depleting substances in some regions and will increasingly affect the extent of recovery. Here we discuss the nature and timescales of ozone recovery, and explore the extent to which it can be currently detected in different atmospheric regions.
citation.title: Detecting recovery of the stratospheric ozone layer

reddit.title: It is in fact possible to solve global environmental problems when people want to: this is what recovery of the ozone layer looks like
Today marks 30 years since the Montreal Protocol successfully outlawed chemicals that deplete the ozone layer and scientists say they can detect ozone recovery

news.title: After 30 years of the Montreal Protocol, the ozone layer is gradually healing
